results.title: Playing together
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
Scenes from the many sports played in Britain, stressing the need for the young to have opportunities to learn to play sport and its value as a character builder.

results.title: Ideas of their own
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The most significant development of the child in his third year is his use of language. His mother can help him greatly by talking and listening to him, reading stories and nursery rhymes and sharing picture books. At this age a child develops an increased sense of his own identity, words such as ‘you’ and ‘I’, ‘yours’ and ‘mine’ take on meaning.

results.title: The Early years
results.creator_credit: George Inger, Eileen Molony, BBC-TV and Bristol Education Authority
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The importance of the early years of childhood is discussed by Dr. K. Lovell of the Institute of Education, University of Leeds, Dr. C.B. Hindley of the Centre for Study of Human Development, University of London, and Dr. W.A. Marshall of the Institute of Child Health, University of London.

results.title: Babyhood
results.creator_credit: George Luger, Eileen Molony and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
A paediatrician analyses the stages of development during the first year of a child’s life. Suggestions are made for cheap and easily improvised play materials and toys.

results.title: Sharing the roads safely
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
investigates pedestrians, bicycles, domestic pets, and children as hazards for the driver. Suggests that accident-free driving for all vehicles sharing the road should be the aim for all people.

results.title: Overtaking and being overtaken
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Suggests ways in which the defensive driver can overtake and how to react to being overtaken. Shows the pitfalls leading to accidents while overtaking and being overtaken. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Mystery single vehicle crash
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Although many drivers involved in single vehicle crashes attribute the cause of their accidents to mechanical failures of the car, very often it was the driver and not the car who was to blame. This film stresses that while mechanical checks of one’s car most important, it is even more vital that the driver is in good physical and mental condition before taking to the road.

results.title: The Head on collision
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Made for the Department of Transport, this film shows distractions both inside and outside the car, tiredness, “highway hypnosis”, and alcohol - as the major causes of head-on collisions. Explains how these can be avoided. Suitable for upper secondary level.
